@HentaiKingTestamentBasara I think you've seen a lot of anime. LOL. In real life, there are cases that childhood friends have a relationship. And the truth is common for two reasons: 1) The childhood friend-friend relationship is not as romantic as it is seen in fiction. It is simply about two children who live together, play, fight and sometimes distance themselves for a while. The problem is that fiction romanticizes it: stating that there is a lasting friendship, when it is not. That's why there is no friend zone at that age. 2) Later, these children grow up and may feel attraction since their friendship is not defined yet. In the end, some of them end up together without caring if it's a friend he's known from a young age. The friend zone exists when that girl or boy, in adolescence, REAFFIRMS their feeling of friendship in front of this person. There it is difficult for the boy to have a chance, even if he confesses. But if the girl also has feelings for him, they could b together
:( Would’ve been nice if the two childhood friends had an intimate relationship, I guess I’d prefer that over this NTR.

Apparently, changing tactics is a no-go for her. Ends up staying with confessor, claims to be romantically attracted to him (I doubt that to be honest), and the end. Unfortunately, this is just more contrived nonsense. Yay!
